message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.MM, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of multiple measurement vector (MMV) in compressive sensing, which involves the recovery of sparse signal vectors from undersampled noisy measurements. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT), machine learning (cs.LG), signal processing (cs.SP), matrix multiplication (cs.MM), and statistical inference (cs.SI). The paper proposes a Bayesian approximate message passing algorithm that exploits temporal correlations in the amplitudes of non-zero coefficients, and provides soft estimates of the signal vectors as well as the underlying support. The algorithm has a linear computational complexity and is suitable for high-dimensional problems. The paper also describes an expectation-maximization algorithm for automatic parameter tuning. Overall, the paper covers a broad range of topics in computer science and is likely to be relevant to multiple arXiv CS sub-categories.
